tips: Nodes are the environments where you plan to run your applications.
description: Nodes are the deployment targets. You can add a new node by installing dyrector.ioâ€™s agents on your environment using a one-liner generated.
noItems: You haven't added any nodes yet. To add a new node click 'Add' on the top right.
nodeAlreadyInUse: This node is already in use in some deployments.
scriptExplanation: The following 'Generate script' button will create a one-liner and script that will install our agent to the target host with the selected technology.

docker: Docker or podman installed on host
Ability to execute the script on host

youCanInstall: You can install an agent on your environment by running a script generated here. You're able to generate one after saving this node.
connectionExplanation: If the setup was successful, you will see your node appear here.
persistentDataExplanation: Stores basic operational data and serves as a base path for containers using relative volume names. Environment variables are resolved, but it is suggested to use absolute paths and avoid special characters.
optionalLeaveEmptyForDefaults: Optional, leave empty for default paths
updateAvailable: There is an update available for your node. You can update it with the update button below.
updateRequired: This agent is incompatible with the current version of dyrector.io. You can update it with the update button below.
traefikExplanation: Traefik is a reverse proxy which lets users deploy services to subdomains as well as use HTTPS.
